intro: Polygala carniolica, commonly known as the Carniola milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, bead-like fruits. Polygala carniolica is a perennial herb that is relatively uncommon and can be found in specific regions of the Balkans and southern Europe.
